observation_target.name: CEO Directive Wave 11 - Acceptance Path Validation (Controlled Shadow)
observation_target.operating_mode: SHADOW / PAPER ONLY (--force flag due to data freshness)

directive_reference.ceo_directive: CEO DIRECTIVE WAVE 11: ACCEPTANCE PATH VALIDATION (CONTROLLED SHADOW)
directive_reference.objective: Validate that the system can say 'yes' correctly when conditions are favorable

precondition_summary.rationale_for_force: Hourly bar architecture limits freshness to ~1-2 hours. Data was reasonably fresh (117 min vs 18+ hours before ingest).

high_rate_lt_30.note: Per CEO Directive: 'If HIGH > 30%, the system is deemed overly permissive'

root_cause_analysis.primary_finding: SitC Planner confidence thresholds are too permissive under non-stress conditions

contributing_factors.detail: Price data at 117 min was below the 120 min DATA_BLACKOUT threshold
contributing_factors.impact: All hypotheses processed without stress modifiers

contributing_factors.detail: Regime confidence at 0.98 far exceeds 0.55 FOG_OF_WAR threshold
contributing_factors.impact: No uncertainty introduced by regime state

contributing_factors.detail: SitC has stress/no-stress binary but lacks nuanced confidence grading
contributing_factors.impact: All hypotheses that pass basic validation get HIGH

contributing_factors.detail: Hypothesis quality not compared against empirical alpha track record

recommended_remediation: Implement multi-tier confidence grading (not just HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW)
Add empirical validation layer (compare hypothesis patterns to historical outcomes)
Lower the HIGH confidence bar significantly
Require evidence quality scoring, not just presence

wave_10_behavior.interpretation: System correctly rejects under adverse conditions

wave_11_behavior.interpretation: System incorrectly accepts everything under normal conditions

contrasting_evidence.conclusion: The system demonstrates restraint under stress but lacks judgment under normalcy

governance_implications.blocking_issue: Cannot proceed to G2 until rejection discipline is demonstrated under clean conditions

positive: SitC plan creation and logging functional
concerning: 100% acceptance rate under any conditions is a governance red flag
Stress mode is binary (on/off) without gradation
The acceptance path works but lacks selectivity

constitutional_locks_status.note: Constitutional locks were maintained. The system correctly stayed in shadow mode.

immediate: Do NOT proceed to G2 Eligibility Review
Document this as a calibration failure, not a system failure
Wave 11 must be re-run after threshold recalibration
before_wave_11_retry: Add corpus-based validation (compare to known-good/bad patterns)
Create tiered confidence thresholds with clear evidence requirements
Define what distinguishes HIGH from MEDIUM in non-stress conditions
architectural: Consider adding a 'skepticism layer' that requires extraordinary evidence for HIGH
Implement ensemble voting for acceptance decisions
Add negative evidence tracking (reasons to reject)

required_before_g2: CEO Directive Wave 11.1: Confidence Threshold Recalibration
Implement and test new discrimination logic
Re-run Wave 11 with target: HIGH 5-20%, Rejection >= 50%
Demonstrate that the system can say 'yes' selectively, not universally

executive_summary.headline: Wave 11 FAILED: System Overly Permissive (100% acceptance vs 5-20% target)
executive_summary.key_insight: Wave 10 proved the system has restraint. Wave 11 revealed it lacks judgment.
executive_summary.path_forward: Implement hypothesis discrimination logic before Wave 11 retry
